intro: Koeleria monantha, commonly known as the slender wheatgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of North America, Europe, and Asia. This perennial plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Its slender stems and small, spike-like inflorescences are characteristic of the genus Koeleria. Koeleria monantha is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinators.
